The Germany national grading scheme for High school consists of  six grade levels with
                                    numerical equivalents: sehr gut – 1 (very good); gut – 2 (good);
                                    befriedigend – 3 (satisfatory); ausrcichend – 4 (addequate);
                                    mangelhalft  – 5 (unsatisfactory- fail); ungenügend – 6
                                    (insufficient- fail). The minimum passing grade is ausrcichend –
                                    4. /n Equivalents in points: 15, 14, 13 – 1 (very good); 12, 11,
                                    10 – 2 (good); 09, 08, 07– 3 (satisfatory); 06, 05, 04– 4
                                    (addequate); 03, 02, 01– 5 (unsatisfactory- fail); 0– 6
                                    (insufficient- fail).
Higher  Education Entrance Qualification - German International ABITUR School
